intro: Malvastrum lacteum, commonly known as the milkweed plant, is a flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as butterflies and bees. It is native to regions in the Americas and is often found in disturbed soils and open fields. Malvastrum lacteum has a milky sap that is toxic to some animals, including livestock.
